009
010package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
017
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Implements an efficient, closed form algorithm for calculating the real 
024 * eigenvalues (&lambda;) and eigenvectors (x) of a 2x2 matrix of the form
025 * </p>
026 * <pre>
027 *   | a b |
028 *   | c d | </pre>
029 * <p>
030 * There are typically (but not always) two pairs of real-valued 
031 * solutions 
032 * &lang;&lambda;<sub>0</sub>, x<sub>0</sub>&rang;,
033 * &lang;&lambda;<sub>1</sub>, x<sub>1</sub>&rang;
034 * such that A&middot;x<sub>k</sub> = &lambda;<sub>k</sub>&middot;x<sub>k</sub>.
035 * The resulting eigensystems are ordered such that
036 * &lambda;<sub>0</sub> &ge; &lambda;<sub>1</sub>.
037 * Eigenvectors are not normalized, i.e., no unit vectors
038 * (any scalar multiple of an Eigenvector is an Eigenvector too).
039 * Non-real eigenvalues are not handled.
040 * Clients should call method {@link #isReal()} to check if the 
041 * eigenvalue calculation was successful.
042 * </p>
043 * <p>
044 * This implementation is inspired by Ch. 5 ("Consider the Lowly 2x2 Matrix") of [1].
045 * Note that Blinn uses the notation 
046 * x&middot;A = &lambda;&middot;x for the matrix-vector product (as common in computer graphics),
047 * while this implementation uses 
048 * A&middot;x = &lambda;&middot;x.
049 * Thus x is treated as a column vector and matrix A is transposed (elements b/c are exchanged).
050 * </p>
051 * <p>
052 * This implementation is considerably faster (ca. factor 5) than the general solution
053 * available in {@link EigenDecompositionJama} (based on Apache Commons Math) for 2x2 matrices.
054 * </p>
055 * <p>
056 * [1] Blinn, Jim: "Jim Blinn's Corner: Notation, Notation, Notation", Morgan Kaufmann (2002).
057 * </p>
058 * 
059 * @author W. Burger
060 * @version 2022/02/18
061 * 
062 */
063public class Eigensolver2x2 implements RealEigenDecomposition { // to check: http://www.akiti.ca/Eig2Solv.html
064        
065        private final boolean isReal;
066        private final double[] eVals = {Double.NaN, Double.NaN};
067        private final double[][] eVecs = new double[2][];
068        
069        /**
070         * Constructor, takes a 2x2 matrix.
071         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
072         */
073        public Eigensolver2x2(double[][] A) {
074                this(A[0][0], A[0][1], A[1][0], A[1][1]);
075                if (Matrix.getNumberOfRows(A) != 2 || Matrix.getNumberOfColumns(A) != 2) {
076                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix not of size 2x2");
077                }
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Constructor, takes the individual elements of a 2x2 matrix A:
082         * <pre>
083         *   | a b |
084         *   | c d | </pre>
085         * @param a matrix element A[0,0]
086         * @param b matrix element A[0,1]
087         * @param c matrix element A[1,0]
088         * @param d matrix element A[1,1]
089         */
090        public Eigensolver2x2(double a, double b, double c, double d) {
091                isReal = solve(a, b, c, d);
092        }
093        
094        private boolean solve(final double a, final double b, final double c, final double d) {
095                final double R = (a + d) / 2;
096                final double S = (a - d) / 2;
097                final double rho = sqr(S) + b * c;
098                
099                if (rho < 0) {  
100                        return false;           // no real-valued eigenvalues
101                }
102                
103                final double T = Math.sqrt(rho);
104                final double lambda0 = R + T;   // eigenvalue 0
105                final double lambda1 = R - T;   // eigenvalue 1
106                final double[] x0, x1;                  // eigenvectors 0, 1
107                
108                if (a - d > 0) {
109//                      System.out.println("Case 1");
110                        x0 = new double[] {S + T, c};
111                        x1 = new double[] {b, -(S + T)};
112                }
113                else if (a - d < 0) {
114//                      System.out.println("Case 2");
115                        x0 = new double[] {b, -S + T};
116                        x1 = new double[] {S - T, c};
117                }
118                else {          // (A - D) == 0
119//                      System.out.println("Case 3");
120                        final double bA = Math.abs(b);
121                        final double cA = Math.abs(c);
122                        final double bcR = Math.sqrt(b * c);
123                        if (bA < cA) {                                                  // |b| < |c|
124//                              System.out.println("Case 3a");
125                                x0 = new double[] { bcR, c};
126                                x1 = new double[] {-bcR, c};
127                        }
128                        else if (bA > cA) {                                     // |b| > |c|
129//                              System.out.println("Case 3b");
130                                x0 = new double[] {b,  bcR};
131                                x1 = new double[] {b, -bcR};
132                        }
133                        else {  // |B| == |C| and B,C must have the same sign
134//                              System.out.println("Case 3c");
135                                if (cA > 0) {   // 
136                                        x0 = new double[] { c, c};
137                                        x1 = new double[] {-c, c};
138                                }
139                                else { // B = C = 0; any vector is an eigenvector (we don't return trivial zero vectors)
140                                        x0 = new double[] { 0, 1};      // pick 2 arbitrary, orthogonal vectors
141                                        x1 = new double[] { 1, 0};
142                                }
143                        }
144                }
145                
146                eVals[0] = lambda0;
147                eVals[1] = lambda1;
148                eVecs[0] = x0;
149                eVecs[1] = x1;
150                
151                // lambda0 >= lambda1, no need to sort by magnitude
152                
153//              if (Math.abs(lambda0) >= Math.abs(lambda1)) {   // order eigenvalues by magnitude
154//                      eVals[0] = lambda0;
155//                      eVals[1] = lambda1;
156//                      eVecs[0] = x0;
157//                      eVecs[1] = x1;
158//              }
159//              else {
160//                      eVals[0] = lambda1;
161//                      eVals[1] = lambda0;
162//                      eVecs[0] = x1;
163//                      eVecs[1] = x0;
164//              }
165                return true;    // real eigenvalues
166        }
167        
168        public boolean isReal() {
169                return isReal;
170        }
171        
172        @Override
173        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
174                return !isReal;
175        }
176        
177        @Override
178        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
179                return eVals;
180        }
181        
182        @Override
183        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k) {
184                return eVals[k];
185        }
186        
187        @Override
188        public RealMatrix getV() {
189                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Matrix.transpose(eVecs));
190        }
191        
192        @Override
193        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k) {
194                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(eVecs[k]);
195        }
196        
197        @Override
198        public String toString() {
199                if (this.isReal) {
200                        return String.format("<%.4f, %.4f, %s, %s>", 
201                                eVals[0], eVals[1], Matrix.toString(eVecs[0]), Matrix.toString(eVecs[1]));
202                }
203                else {
204                        return "<not real>";
205                }
206        }
207
208                
209}
